Doc:
<Doc>
Return to the Blue Lagoonï½œ16-year-old Milla Jovovich
Return to the Blue Lagoon.
	
Directed by William A. Graham, starring Milla Jovovich and Brian Krause.
	
The film is divided into three parts.
	
The first part is the childhood meeting of Richard and Lilli. Richard drifts with his parents' ship and is taken in by the captain of the ship where Lilli is. Unfortunately, the crew starts showing symptoms of cholera, and Lilli's mother is forced to continue drifting with Lilli and Richard.
	
The second part is their growth from infants to teenagers, which is very joyful. Their mother dies of lung disease.
	
The third part is their adolescence, where they grow up, fall in love, and get married. This part is somewhat similar to Tarzan.
	
Essentially, the focus of this film is on the third part. Milla Jovovich is only 16 years old, but her performance is bold enough, already resembling a pure and beautiful young girl.
	
Just six years later, she made a groundbreaking appearance in Luc Besson's The Fifth Element.
	
      
</Doc>

These Nine Apps Are Enough for Civil Service Exam Candidates
People's Daily, which contains articles from some big names, very useful for our verbal comprehension, essay writing, and interviews
Civil Service Exam Radar APP, users can follow announcements and select positions, input their information, and big data will find matching positions for you, thus precisely pushing some positions to you
China Comment, with many functions, my personal favorite is the daily current affairs check-in, spending 5-10 minutes each day is much more comfortable than reading long articles
Pomodoro Todo, has a phone lock function, suitable for those with weak self-control
Mubu: great for organizing mind maps
Huatu Online, an online education platform, mainly for public service education modules, covering civil servants, public institutions, teacher qualifications, postgraduate entrance exams, medical, accounting, and other subcategories
Of course, Baidu Wangpan is also an indispensable APP, where you can buy some cheap courses from famous teachers, much cheaper than the official website, saving a lot of money

content:
Query: 
Online Financial Management Course Teacher Recommendation on Bilibili
Level:
Teacher's Name

Doc:
<Doc>
Studying for the CPA, buying online courses
Hmm, encountered a reliable online course seller
Because he always gives me discounts, I posted an ad on Xiaohongshu,
I'll continue to buy courses from him next year and ask for more discounts [GrinningR][GrinningR][GrinningR][GrinningR]
This is my third year taking the intermediate exam, and I passed.
When I was reviewing at the beginning of the year, I was actually very worried
Finally found a teacher I like on Bilibili, and then met this online course seller.
Although it's only 10 yuan per course (it's a teacher from an unknown education institution that I've never heard of, but I really like this teacher's style and pace. I saw this teacher's course on Bilibili, named Zou Yu, from Yi Guo Education, teaching intermediate financial management), following this teacher, I really understood financial management, improving from 53.25 points in 2022 to 71 points this year, hahahaha. Teacher Zou helped me unblock my meridians.
	
Courses from well-known institutions are a bit more expensive
	
For the three intermediate courses, I followed teachers from three different institutions [EmbarrassedR][EmbarrassedR], and I took some detours when choosing institutions, resulting in higher costs, but luckily I passed in the end.
Now I'm preparing to try the CPA accounting
I bought 5-year courses for 6 subjects on the official website, tried listening to several teachers' courses, and read many recommendations, asked for a lot of shares on Xiaohongshu, and finally decided to follow Teacher Ma's accounting
I followed Teacher Ma for the intermediate accounting and barely passed with a low score~~~~ If I hadn't passed the intermediate accounting last year, I think I would have given up on the intermediate exam this year, hehe
	
Listening to more teachers and trying more styles, if you can find a teacher you like, the review will feel very easy
	
Even if the learning process is tortuous and costs a lot of time and money, as long as there is a good result in the end, all the efforts are meaningful.
So, if you can meet a reliable course seller, you should make good use of it
The road is long, but it will be reached by walking
Although I'm not disciplined, love playing with my phone, and have a bad memory, I've been on the path of learning and haven't strayed too far.
This seller's courses, buying one course will have teachers from several institutions
I bought courses from this online course at the beginning of the year, and they were updated steadily until before the exam
Close to the exam, I bought a crash course from them again,
Listened to crash courses from other teachers, including Dongdong, Liangshan, etc.,
I found that different institutions really have different focuses, and I'm not comprehensive in my studies (I admit I'm a poor student) but listening to the key points from several teachers, most of the exam key points are covered [ShyR][ShyR][ShyR]
Although I bought Dongdong's official online course, I still want to listen to more teachers' courses, one main and one auxiliary
Sometimes a difficult point, listening to different teachers' explanations, can suddenly become clear
</Doc>
answer:
<rewrite_query>Name of the recommended financial management online course teacher on Bilibili</rewrite_query>
<relevance_analysis>The Doc is relevant to the rewrite_query because the Doc mentions the name of the recommended financial management online course teacher on Bilibili.</relevance_analysis>
<AnswerList>["Zou Yu"]</AnswerList>
<Result>[{"Option": "Zou Yu", "Reason": "I saw this teacher's course on Bilibili, named Zou Yu, from Yi Guo Education, teaching intermediate financial management"}]</Result>

content:
Query: 
Yellow Tower Peak Hiking Route
Level:
Check-in Spot

Doc:
<Doc>
There are three ways to walk to the Shiliang Waterfall, which one is more energy-saving?
There are three ways to walk to the Shiliang Waterfall. See Figure 3, purple is the 1st route, blue is the 2nd, and yellow is the 3rd.

First method, conventional [SmileR]
From the visitor center all the way to the bottom of the Shiliang Waterfall, it takes an hour, and it's all cobblestone paths, not easy to walk. Although there are some small views, it can only slightly alleviate boredom. After reaching the bottom of the Shiliang Waterfall, going up to the Guangfang Temple is a continuous climb of steps, very tiring. Then, to the exit, you still need to walk more than 600 meters. After reaching the exit, you need to take the scenic area's vehicle back to the visitor center parking lot. Personally, I think this design is extremely foolish, not only tiring for the legs but also extremely wasteful of time. Of course, if you just want to walk through the valley and roam for half a day, it's suitable.

Second method, enter from the old entrance (use Gaode navigation, locate: Southeast Parking Lot of Tiantai Mountain Shiliang Scenic Area, Figure 8) [SmileR].
Soon after the entrance, you can see the Middle Guangfang Temple, which is above the Shiliang Waterfall. The Middle Guangfang Temple is currently under maintenance and cannot be entered. From the temple, you can circle down beside the Shiliang. A continuous flight of steps leads down to the Old Guangfang Temple, and a few more steps down is the classic panoramic spot of the Shiliang Waterfall. Then, walk all the way back to the visitor center. From the Small Copper Kettle Waterfall, it's also a continuous climb of steps, shorter than the first method from the bottom of the waterfall, but it also has a vertical elevation of 50-70 meters, which is also tiring for the legs.
Before reaching the visitor center (right beside the steps to the visitor center), there is a small path that crosses a small hill back to the old entrance parking lot, taking about 10~15 minutes. This section also involves climbing and requires someone in good physical condition. Driving from the old entrance parking lot to the visitor center parking lot takes less than 10 minutes. See Figures 9~12 for details.
This method is often mentioned on Little Sweet Potato as a labor-saving strategy. But it didn't really save much effort. If you definitely want to walk the entire route, the second method is more suitable than the first. At the same time, a companion needs to be willing to climb an extra 10 minutes of mountain road to drive.

Third method, follow the second method all the way down to the bottom of the Shiliang Waterfall. Then return the same way. [SmileR]
Although you have to walk a long section of steps, it involves walking an extra 2-3 kilometers of mountain road, and climbing a section of steps to exit, I think this method might be more friendly to the legs. And it's also suitable for people who are short on time. To see what the Small Copper Kettle Waterfall and the First Seal of the World look like, see Figures 6-7. Judge for yourself if it's worth walking those 2~3 kilometers of mountain road. </Doc>

content:
Query: 
Tianjin Fun Shopping Malls
Level:
Mall Name

Doc:
<Doc>
Tianjin clothing prices...
Tianjin, as a city with a long history and diverse culture, also presents a unique style in its clothing culture. From historical evolution to modern fashion, Tianjin's clothing market is equally rich and varied, catering to the needs of different groups. Here is some information about Tianjin's clothing:
1. **Tianjin's Clothing Culture**: Tianjin's clothing culture blends local, foreign, and Western influences, forming its own unique style. Tianjin people's attire ranges from the noble and luxurious of wealthy merchants to the simplicity of common folk. Tianjin women are forthright and prefer bright red and green colors, while the working class has its typical attire, such as the "Erda Cotton Jacket".
2. **Recommended Shopping Locations**:
- **Binjiang Road**: As one of Tianjin's commercial centers, Binjiang Road has many brand clothing stores, often with discounts and sales.
- **Friendship New World**: The basement here often hosts large markets with good service quality.
- **Lebin**: Features a large Etam store, frequently holding sales.
- **Maigou**: Goods here are mostly sourced from Dahutong, with negotiable prices.
- **Oule Fashion Center**: Unique styles, bargaining is possible, and sometimes clearance sales occur.
- **Nanjing Road**: International malls like Hisense Isetan have higher prices but better quality.
3. **Market Shopping**:
- **Hongqiao Market**: One of Tianjin's largest traditional markets, selling various commercial products, including clothing.
- **Dahutong**: You can find street stall goods at relatively low prices, but it requires a keen eye to select.
4. **Online Shopping**: With the development of the internet, online shopping has become the preferred method for many to buy clothes, being convenient and fast.
5. **Weather and Dressing**: According to Tianjin's weather forecast and dressing index, appropriate clothing should be chosen for different seasons. For example, light down jackets may be needed in spring, while short sleeves and cool clothing are suitable for summer.
6. **Tianjin Clothing Brands**: Tianjin also has some local clothing brands, which can be found on platforms like Liren Clothing Network with relevant rankings and recommendations.
7. **Funeral Clothing Culture**: Tianjin people have their own beliefs and taboos regarding funeral clothing, reflecting a special emotional attachment and respect for clothing culture.
In summary, Tianjin's clothing market blends traditional elements with modern fashion, allowing consumers to choose suitable shopping methods and locations based on their preferences and needs. Meanwhile, Tianjin's clothing culture also reflects the city's deep historical heritage and the integration of diverse cultures.

Pet Cat Wet Wipes Recommendation

Doc:
<Doc>
Extremely Comprehensive!! A real and unbiased review of 10 self-used wet wipes!!!
I spent several days compiling this note, focusing on aspects such as price, material, texture, moisture content, thickness, hand feel, resilience, and cleaning power, comparing these ten wet wipes I've used (as shown in the above image)

1ï¸âƒ£ Zichu: ğŸ’°7, inexpensive but the hand feel is not great, feels a bit thin, and has average moisture content, and also tends to dispense multiple sheets at once

2ï¸âƒ£ Purcotton: ğŸ’°10, excellent hand feel, very good moisture content! All cotton, very soft, but also prone to deformation

3ï¸âƒ£ October Crystallization: ğŸ’°10, decent thickness, average hand feel, I would choose Purcotton at the same price point

4ï¸âƒ£ Curious Baby: ğŸ’°9, features: dual-sided texture (one side pearl, one side flat) but has a slight odor, not great hand feel, thin, and extremely low moisture content!

5ï¸âƒ£ Kexinrou: ğŸ’°10, good thickness, hand feel, and moisture content, but the lid is hard to open, making it difficult to use with one hand

6ï¸âƒ£ Wanyan: ğŸ’°6, cute duck-shaped lid, smaller size compared to others, but decent hand feel and moisture content for the price

7ï¸âƒ£ GB Good Baby: ğŸ’°9, decent hand feel, good thickness, strong resilience, but has a strong odor

8ï¸âƒ£ Manxi: ğŸ’°10 (bought at a promotional price, usually around 19 yuan per pack), good hand feel, thickness, and moisture content, worth considering at a promotional price, but expensive at the regular price

9ï¸âƒ£ BBC: ğŸ’°13, good hand feel, moisture content, and thickness, but occasionally dispenses multiple sheets

ğŸ”Ÿ Babudou: ğŸ’°15, good hand feel and thickness, high moisture content!

ğŸ’« My selection criteria for wet wipes:

First and foremost is cost-effectiveness, as wet wipes are consumables

âœ¨ Dispensing issues: Zichu and BBC occasionally dispense multiple sheets, others do not, which is inconvenient and can lead to secondary contamination

âœ¨ Lid opening: Sometimes need to open with one hand while holding a child, so I prefer easy-to-open lids. Kexinrou is difficult to open, Purcotton is slightly difficult but manageable

âœ¨ Texture: Except for Purcotton and October Crystallization which are flat (others are pearl), flat texture is soft and suitable for face wiping, pearl texture has more friction and is better for cleaning bottoms

âœ¨ Moisture and thickness: Must choose high moisture content and thick wipes for better cleaning power and durability

Cost-effectiveness ranking: Purcotton - Wanyan - Kexinrou - Manxi - Babudou - BBC - Zichu - October Crystallization - Good Baby - Curious Baby
</Doc>

content:

New Granary Food

Doc:
<Doc>
New Granary is too city-like! The best hot pot skewers in Hefei!
Aside from the delicious pot base, the most soulful aspect must be the fresh ingredients.
I had already lost interest in hot pot skewers, and this restaurant had quite a bit of marketing before. Despite various factors, even after purchasing a Dianping VIP package for over 20 yuan, it didn't stop me from exploring.
After watching Jolin Tsai's concert, I thought it was already late and would miss the peak dining time, but I still ended up waiting for 90 tables [crying laugh R]. After waiting for over half an hour, they gave us forty extra skewers, which meant the package that cost over 20 yuan included 120 skewers alone!
The most recommended are the thin skewer beef series, very fresh and tasty. The skewers here are easy to peel off after cooking, providing great convenience for those who like to eat them in a bowl. The pots here are also deep, and a four-person table has four hidden skewer tubes, which is quite user-friendly.

The free grapes were so delicious that I wanted to ask the boss where he bought them. The crispy pork in the package, although small in portion, was very tasty and could be offered in a larger portion.
Finally, I don't recommend the fried rice, plate meat, and watermelon lemon tea. The fried rice was average according to my tablemates, and although the plate meat was cheap, I felt it lacked the uniqueness of the skewers. Maybe the restaurant could change the syrup base for the watermelon lemon tea, as it was a bit too sweet. #Hefei Food [topic]# #New Granary [topic]#

1. The game board is arranged in a tic-tac-toe or nine-square grid, with each side having 3 pieces.
2. Before the game starts, participants are evenly distributed within the rainbow circle, each holding a game item.
3. In the form of a relay race, each person from both sides runs from the starting point to the game board to take turns placing their pieces.
4. After placing the pieces, they can be moved up and down or left and right.
5. The team that first arranges three pieces in a line wins.

Nanchuanlou Food in Cangzhou

Doc:
<Doc>
Cangzhou Food Sharing (No Pitfalls Edition)
Cangzhou may sound ordinary at first, but it's actually a city worth exploring. Nowadays, traveling isn't just about seeking developed cities, but rather about experiencing unique characteristics. Cangzhou boasts not only the Grand Canal but also ancient structures like Nanchuanlou and Qingfenglou, along with a significant Hui population. Every school I attended had a halal canteen that was the best place to eat, showcasing the culinary skills of the Hui people.
[Blow Kiss R]1. Hotpot Chicken, a dish that has spread far and wide from Cangzhou. The 0317 chain offers service and ambiance comparable to the hotpot chicken equivalent of Haidilao, but local shops serve equally delicious and affordable versions. Remember to dip it in vinegar!
[Blow Kiss R]2. Beef Pie. Larger than my palm, incredibly thick and flavorful. Shocked by Cangzhou's affordable prices, a mere 3 yuan for such a delightful pie!
[Blow Kiss R]3. Fried Cake. Perfectly puffed, with a crispy exterior and a thin layer of glutinous rice and sweet bean paste inside. Just one yuan, unchanged for decades, sold only for a few hours in the afternoon.
[Blow Kiss R]4. Donkey Burger. The authentic version features a crispy bun and tender, flavorful meat, often paired with a collagen-rich stew. A must-try with a bowl of seaweed egg soup.
[Blow Kiss R]5. Tofu Skin. Found in a street stall near Qingfenglou, offering spicy and non-spicy options. Top-notch snack!
[Blow Kiss R]6. Teppanyaki. A unique cooking style that's not quite grilling but incredibly tasty.
Visiting Cangzhou guarantees weight gain with so many delicious foods to try. Looking forward to more updates on fun activities!
</Doc>

content:
Query: 
Foreign Outdoor Games
Level:
Game Name

Doc:
<Doc>
Danish Traditional Christmas Party Game Pakkelag
Haha, I'm not a qualified blogger, I forget to take photos and videos while playing, sorry everyone! But this is really so much fun, the atmosphere is full, after all, who doesn't like small gifts [PartyR][NosePickingR][LikeR]

This game is very simple, just prepare gifts + dice (you can bring cups or not) + alarm clock (phone timer is also fine)

1ï¸âƒ£Pakkeleg Gaver
Everyone participating in the game should prepare at least one gift (usually wrapped, so you can't see what the gift is), it doesn't need to be expensive, just normal, small gifts bought from Normal, Flying Tiger for 20dkk-30dkk are fine, bring a few more for fun.
2ï¸âƒ£Rules
ğŸ’•Before the game starts, all gifts are placed in the middle of the table. Then each person takes turns rolling the dice, if a 6 is rolled, you can pick a favorite gift, if it's not 6, it's the next person's turn, and this continues until all gifts are distributed. At this point, some people may not have chosen a gift, and some people may have several gifts, then the exciting part begins!
ğŸ’•At this point, start the timer, set a time that everyone agrees on, like 10 minutes, at this point different numbers rolled on the dice correspond to different rules.
ğŸ˜‰If a 1 is rolled, you must give one of your gifts to someone else

ğŸ˜˜If a 6 is rolled, you can 'steal' a gift from someone else

During this process, all gifts must be placed in front of you, not hidden! There are also different variations of these number rules, for example, if it's 2, everyone must switch to the position on your left, or simply, everyone gives their gift to the person on their left, if it's 3, you give it to the person on your right.
ğŸ’•When the alarm clock rings, the gifts belong to the person who ultimately gets them.

Haha, how many gifts you can get in the end depends on luck!

Some other tips:
â¤ï¸Julesange Christmas Music
Once the background music starts, you can feel the atmosphere at the door, friends looking for background music can search for julesange, there are many playlists on YouTube that last an hour.
ğŸ’šJulesmÃ¥kager Christmas Cookies
JulesmÃ¥kager are usually made in different shapes, because they contain ginger powder and cinnamon powder, which is Gingerbread, if you make gingerbread in the shape of a person, it's Gingerbread men, if it's in the shape of a house, it's a Gingerbread house.
â¤ï¸Mandelgave
Mandelgave is also a small gift, usually at Christmas parties, people will have rice pudding as dessert, Mandelgave is given to the person who finds an almond in the rice pudding, it's a bit like our tradition of putting a coin in dumplings. The person who finds the almond in the rice pudding gets an extra gift!!

That's all! Wishing everyone a Merry Christmas!

</Doc>

content:
Query: 
Games Suitable for Group Play
Level:
Game Name

Doc:
<Doc>
Large Group Building Activitiesï½œWhat method of grouping is more fun?
1âƒ£ï¸0âƒ£ï¸ Classic Fun Grouping Icebreaker Games
Simple props, easy to operate! Fun, interactive, and atmosphere UPUPUP!
Â·
01. Love Hug
Play a piece of music, everyone forms a circle, and then the leader randomly says a number that everyone must immediately hug together. For example, 70 people can be divided into 7 groups, so shout 10, and those who hug together automatically form a group.
02. WeChat Dice Roll
Create a group chat, each participant rolls the dice once, and finally groups are formed based on odd and even numbers. You can also group 1 and 2 together, 3 and 4 together, and 5 and 6 together.
03. Counting Grouping
Boys count in sequence 12345, and girls count in sequence 54321, finally grouping those who count the same number together.
04. Puzzle Grouping
Taking 70 people as an example, 14 people per group, divided into 4 groups. Prepare 5 sets of 14-piece puzzles, each person gets one piece, and they need to find others to combine, finally those who complete a full puzzle form a group.
05. Blindfold Grouping
Everyone forms a circle, the host stands in the center with a blindfold, pointing forward. After starting, everyone walks around the circle, the host shouts stop, and whoever the host's arm points to is out. Others continue walking around the circle. This continues until the grouping is complete.
06. Playing Cards Grouping
Prepare playing cards in advance based on the total number of participants and the number of groups. For example, 40 people divided into 4 groups, 10 people per group. Prepare 10 cards each of hearts, spades, diamonds, and clubs. Each person draws a card, and those with the same suit form a group.
07. Seating Grouping
Arrange the seats in advance according to the training or activity requirements, determine the number of groups and the number of people in each group, without specifying each participant's seat. Participants choose their seats independently, and seating determines the group.
08. Table Tennis Grouping
Place different colored table tennis balls in a lucky draw box in advance, participants draw the balls in turn, and those with the same color form a group.
09. Blind Man's Buff
Everyone forms a circle, use a rotating water bottle to select 4 people (these four are the group leaders). The selected 4 need to be blindfolded, and in turn, led by the host, start walking around the inner circle. Whoever their finger points to becomes their group member, until 5 members are selected. Other leaders follow the same steps to select members.
10. Voluntary Method
Everyone forms a circle, the leader randomly says four attributes (colors, fruits, animals, etc.), each person chooses one, and those who choose the same form a group.

content:
Query: 
Recommended script murder stores in Changsha
Level:
Store Name

Doc:
<Doc>
The best deductive script I played this year, Mustard Seed! Highly recommended! 
As the Buddhist scriptures said: 'Mount Sumeru is hidden in a mustard seed, and a mustard seed contains Mount Sumeru,' but what about human nature? 
Mustard Seed Part 1 and Part 2 real review comes here: 
(Trying to avoid spoilers, feel free to read)
Store: Chengfu Exclusive
dm: Mr. Ma, Penpen
Duration: Two days (18h)
Personal Rating: 9 points and above! The best deductive script I've played as of 2024!
Tips before playing: Play Mirage and Fleeting beforehand (at least Fleeting), reserve enough energy and time. We split the game over two days, so it wasn't too exhausting...
Experience:
Changsha has Chengfu's exclusive store, and the store made reasonably good adaptations. Before the game, the dm will also give everyone a recap! You can try it without hesitation!! Mr. Ma is great! Every time I encounter a poorly written script, my complaints will overflow, but when it comes to a good one, I donâ€™t know where to start writing about it... 
Overall, the experience was excellent. Itâ€™s been almost half a month since we finished the script, and there are still some unforgettable moments. However, as Iâ€™m relatively lazy and delayed it for a long time, this will only be a summary review (covering both parts)... 
Part 1 of Mustard Seed leans toward puzzle solving, with some deduction segments but not overly scary. Girls donâ€™t need to worry; the deduction includes some key information. Itâ€™s a test of your memory. Although it doesnâ€™t bring anything completely new to the table, our group still had tons of fun, filled with groan-worthy moments inside and outside the scenario... 
Returning to the script itself, Part 1 serves as a great bridge to the second part. Simultaneously, it provides a complete detective experience and doesn't fall short. A criticism some may have is that it can be hard to identify the riddles, making it challenging to start, which is understandableâ€”after all, who can entirely sync with the author's creativity? In summary, Part 1 might involve slightly more dimensions and offers plentiful content... 
Part 2 returns to roundtable reasoning, focusing on restoration. Personally, I prefer Part 2 because I love piecing the story together. Plus, our group had a 'restoration master' (lol), which made Part 2 extremely entertaining for us. The 'Pure Love War God' Wang Yang, the 'Masochist War God' Xu Chen, and the 'Gambling God' Modiâ€”our team had so many â€˜gods,â€™ hahaâ€¦ 
Back to the script itself: As the mysteries unravel layer by layer, you'll feel chills and marvel at the authorâ€™s schemes and designs. Following the rhythm of 'Alec Chuan,' can you really penetrate the fog and discover the truth? Thatâ€™s something youâ€™ll need to experience yourself... 
Downsides:
1. There are still perspective differences between characters. Some might feel marginal compared to the central characters, but it didnâ€™t affect me much. Honestly, I felt a bit marginal, lol.
2. Although the reading volume isnâ€™t huge, integrating all the information (clues and scripts) requires a certain level of skill.
Conclusion:
I think, despite the long consumption of time and energy, itâ€™s absolutely worth it. It gave a very satisfying conclusion to the Fleeting series. There are some minor flaws, but theyâ€™re not fatal. Comparing it to a similar script from the same period, 'The Silent Scriptwriter,' itâ€™s like heaven versus the abyss. Sorry for ranting about 'The Silent Scriptwriter,' haha. The ending discussion on good and evil also provokes deep thought. I hope 2024 will bring more excellent scripts like this!
</Doc>

content:
Query: 
Which version of 'General History of China' is the best?
Level:
Name of the version

Doc:
<Doc>
Facts are rigorous, the first choice for history beginners: Fu Lecheng's 'General History of China'â—ï¸
ğŸ“šBook Title: 'General History of China'
ğŸ–ŒAuthor: Fu Lecheng
ğŸ“–Publisher: Guizhou Education Press, 2010, 673 pages
	
ğŸŒŸSpent over 40 days (interspersed with reading other books, so took a bit longer) to finish Fu Lecheng's 'General History of China'. The feeling is that the narration of historical facts is rigorous, clear in structure, and easy to understand. If you want to build a framework of ancient Chinese history focusing on historical facts, this book can be the first choice for beginners.
	
Other well-known comprehensive histories include Qian Mu's 'Outline of National History' and LÃ¼ Simian's 'General History of China.' Before reading, I made a comparison myself and finally chose Fu Lecheng's version of the general history.
	
ğŸŒŸFu Lecheng came from the renowned Fu family of historians, which produced many renowned historians noted for their rigorous scholarship. Fu's version of the general history adheres to the style of positive historiography, integrating traditional histories of various dynasties with the actual research findings of modern scholars as well as his own historical studies. It provides a concise account of historical facts and developments from the Paleolithic period to the late Qing dynasty.
	
In the book, Mr. Fu doesn't interject much of his personal commentary, striving to focus objectively on the facts. In terms of selecting historical materials, viewpoints lacking solid evidence and overly subjective statements are excluded.
	
Fuâ€™s history takes the dynastic transitions as its outline, not only explaining the causes and consequences of each dynastic change but also describing aspects of the period such as political systems, economy, diplomacy, culture, and religion, making the content more thorough.
	
ğŸŒ¿Personally, I think the reading challenges are: first, obscure charactersâ€”there are many rare characters in ancient place and personal names; a modern Chinese dictionary app or handwritten input method combined with a search engine can help. Second, during the historical transitions between dynasties, there are numerous events and figures, making the information overwhelming. Organizing the context yourself is necessary; otherwise, it becomes confusing.
	
ğŸŒŸLÃ¼â€™s comprehensive history, as seen in its table of contents, is divided into two parts. The upper part covers 18 aspects such as marriage, family systems, and political systems; the lower part discusses politics. LÃ¼ Simian was erudite and an ancient history expert, recognized as the scholar who read the most history books in the field of history. However, considering this book of general history, it isnâ€™t very beginner-friendly.
	
The whole book cites too much ancient history, written in a mix of semi-classical and semi-modern language, which creates reading barriers. Additionally, for topics like marriage and political systems, specialized works can be read separately. LÃ¼ gathered 18 topics together with wide-ranging sources, often interjecting his own commentary throughout his narration, which leads to a quick and surface-level overview of each aspect. After reading it, one might still feel clouded about how the history of each dynasty developed.
	
ğŸŒŸQian's general history works were written in a rather special era, so his personal historical perspective is strong, and there is a lot of personal insight and commentary. Many editions are in traditional Chinese and vertical layout, making them harder to read.
	
I personally prefer to first understand the historical facts and build a historical framework before reading historians' commentary. Therefore, I chose Fu Lecheng's general history. If I were to recommend books in comprehensive history, Fu Lecheng's version would be my preference.
	
ğŸŒˆI bought the 2010 edition from Guizhou Education Press, secondhand from Kongfuzi old book store online. Other editions seem to have significantly abridged content. There are many books in comprehensive history; you can compare e-versions on WeChat Reading before deciding which physical book to purchase.
	
  
</Doc>
answer:
<rewrite_query>Recommended version of 'General History of China'</rewrite_query>
<relevance_analysis>The Doc is relevant to the rewrite_query since it provides a comparison and recommendation of different versions of 'General History of China,' particularly highlighting Fu Lecheng's version.</relevance_analysis>
<AnswerList>["Fu Lecheng's 'General History of China'"]</AnswerList>
<Result>[{"Option": "Fu Lecheng's 'General History of China'", "Reason": "Facts are rigorous, the first choice for history beginners: Fu Lecheng's 'General History of China'"}]</Result>

<Doc>
I will never play horror scripts again
#ScriptMurder[topic]# #UnderTheMoonlightSariel[topic]# #ChongqingScriptMurderRecommendation[topic]# #Horror[topic]#
Nine out of ten script murder companions recommended this script to me, telling me I must try it. I gave it a go, and as a timid person, I was utterly terrified. Itâ€™s the perfect atmospheric script for horror script enthusiasts~
A brief introduction to the story: Shadows in the mirror, ghostly photos, strange noises, evil dreams, lingering cries â€“ they all haunt you to this day. As memories are slowly unveiled, you enter the Angel Pavilion under the moonlight, recalling your childhood growing up in a boarding school. It was a world already in decay, with dim stars and withered plants. Once you delve deeper into the answers, you find yourself trapped in an inescapable abyss of darkness. Often, the most tempting choices are not the blessings of God but the trials of the devil.
Experience: There were 5 women and 1 man in our group. Throughout the process, someone cried out of fear, and as soon as a solo thread started, people screamed. Itâ€™s not just about scaring you; itâ€™s extreme psychological pressure and psychological fear. My character was Qiao Yu, and every time Xu Liangliang called me Sister Qiao Yu alone, my heart was in my throat. Later, he even asked me to kill himâ€”how could I possibly do that?! By the end, I was so scared that I gave up thinking completely.
When all the truths were revealed later, I was deeply moved by Xu Liangliang. He appeared to be mad and incoherent, but in fact, everything he did was for his companions. He is the real Under The Moonlight Sariel, both an angel and a demon. All the spotlights eventually focused on him, watching him transform from pure transparency to an abyss of darkness.
Kudos to the DM: This script heavily relies on the DMâ€™s performance. Our DM was exceptional, allowing us to be fully immersed. All I remembered was that I was in Saint Baudouin and needed to figure out how to escape my fate and get out of there. However, from the moment you stepped in, you had already made a deal with the devil. This deal was unequal, and without paying the price, you could never get out.
â€˜Iâ€™m leaving. If I return, the only thing you must do is run away without looking back.â€™
</Doc>

â— Egg cheese triangle: The top layer is baked cheese toast, with a filling of salad dressing + chopped egg + thin slices of sausage in the middle. Overall, it has a strong savory flavor, making it suitable for breakfast and quite cost-effective.

Which baby bottle is better for preventing choking

Brand and model

<Doc>
Use middle school physics to analyze the issue of bottle aeration.
Recently, many moms have asked me about anti-colic bottles, which really shocked me:
I never expected the price of these bottles to range from a few dollars to thousands, broader than the Milky Way!
Back then, I directly chose the classic Pigeon wide-neck bottle for Grape without overthinking itâ€¦

Curious about what advanced features these bottles have upgraded, I discovered that the primary focus is on the concept of preventing colic.
After comparison, I found that all three bottles use additional openings to balance the internal and external pressure differences. The principle is identical, only the position of the openings varies, leading to structural differences.

As for baby colic, it ultimately stems from the babyâ€™s underdeveloped gastrointestinal system, and the air inhaled while feeding is only part of the reason. We should not over-worry about it but focus on what we can do: proper use of bottles and nipples, effective burping, and patiently waiting with love for the babyâ€™s digestive system to mature.

If I were to choose, I would still go with the classic Pigeon bottle. Itâ€™s not that others aren't good enough, but the Pigeon bottle offers a better cost-performance ratio overall. As a first-time mom, my blind choice worked well for me~

Pigeon is more baby-friendly:
The nipple is made of bionic silicone material, soft and elastic, closer to a motherâ€™s breast, and easier for the baby to accept;
It offers nipples with segmented flow rates to suit babies of different ages, ensuring milk flows evenly and smoothly without choking;
The anti-colic nipple design prevents the baby from inhaling too much air.
Grape quickly accepted the Pigeon bottle on her first try and happily became a little foodie~

Pigeon is more parent-friendly:
The nipple mimics the state of breastfeeding, fitting the latch-on line and preventing air swallowing and colic. It works for anyone feeding the baby; latch-on is quick and precise;
The wide-neck design is simple, making preparing formula and cleaning easier;
The material is safe, non-toxic, high-temperature resistant, and can be sterilized.

content:
Query: 
Recommendations for novels about challenging levels
Level:
Novel titles

Doc:
<Doc>
Twenty textbook-level god-tier novels, heavily emulated!
1. Pinnacle of Mortal Cultivation: Wang Yu's "A Record of a Mortal's Journey to Immortality"
Comment: If you want to write a novel in the mortal cultivation genre, reading this is essential to truly understand it.
2. Multiverse Genre: Chen Dong's "Shrouding the Heavens"
Comment: In most multiverse-themed novels, "Shrouding the Heavens" is often referencedâ€”definitely a must-read!
3. Dark Xianxia: Weight Loss Expert's "Netherworld Immortal Journey"
Comment: This is a story filled with struggle, where the protagonist wrestles with humanity and the edge of life and death.
4. Doomsday Pinnacle: Tian Xiapiao Huo's "Dark Blood Era"
Comment: There's not much to sayâ€”if you're writing an apocalyptic novel, you have to read this, but don't expect frequent updates!
5. Divine Magic Sweeping Novel: Meng Ru Shen Ji's "Immortality"
Comment: A template for commercial writing, with innovative divine power settingsâ€”truly worth learning!
6. Daoist Technique Genre: Da Li Jin Gang Zhang's "Mao Shan Descendants"
Comment: Must-read for those writing thriller or horror suspense novels. Mao Shan Descendants is a classic worth learning from.
7. Infinite Flow: Zhttty's "Terror Infinity"
Comment: The pioneering work of the infinite flow genre, with great plot, excellent writing, and memorable character portrayals. A must-read for infinite flow writers!
8. Late Ming Dynasty Pinnacle 1: Gray Panda's "Stealing the Ming"
Comment: One of the three great novels aiming to save the Ming Dynasty. It's not a typical power fantasy, nor does it feature historical celebrities.
9. Late Ming Dynasty Pinnacle 2: Ke Shanmeng's "Late Ming"
Comment: Another of the three great novels about saving the Ming Dynasty. It analyzes the fall of the Ming deeply, with profound insights.
10. Ming Dynasty Time Travel: Dangnian Mingyue's "Those Ming Dynasty Days"
Comment: Writing historical time-travel novels set in the Ming Dynasty? This is a must-read! Accurate and entertaining history.
11. Fantasy Benchmark: Zhichou's "Ashes of History"
Comment: A novel that inspires deep contemplation about lifeâ€”thought-provoking and with great depth!
12. Master of Ensemble Casts: Chuiniuzhe's "Rise of the Great Nation"
Comment: The rise of five "waste" individuals from Lingao is told here. No fixed protagonistâ€”a pinnacle example of ensemble storytelling. A must-read for writers of this genre.
13. Humor Peak: Zhang Xiaohua's "The Greatest Chaos Ever Untold"
Comment: For those writing comedic novels, this book is unmissable. Read it to avoid regrets!
14. Fantasy Sweeping Novel: Tiancan Tudou's "Battle Through the Heavens"
Comment: This is the template for fantasy novels. For new fantasy writers, this is essential reading!
15. Martial Arts Pinnacle: Meng Ru Shen Ji's "The Legend of the Dragon and Snakes"
Comment: A perfectly balanced work combining technical elements with storytelling. Essential for aspiring authors.
16. Primordial Mythology Genre: Meng Ru Shen Ji's "The Dao Is Within"
Comment: A pioneering primordial mythology work. None have surpassed its depth yetâ€”a must-read classic!
17. Urban Sweeping Novel: Shili Jiannshen's "Rebirth of the Urban Immortal Cultivator"
Comment: Despite being interrupted by external factors, this book is a must-read for writers of urban novels.
18. Xianxia Benchmark: Youshi Shisan's "The Copper Furnace in Troubled Times"
Comment: Outstandingly elegant writing and a unique world viewâ€”worth exploring despite its incomplete status.

content:
Query: 
Liuzhou Workers' Hospital obstetrician recommendation
Level:
Doctor's Name

Doc:
<Doc>
Avoid the Provincial Maternity and Child Health Hospital obstetrician, you'll regret it if you choose them.
Previously, I saw many reviews on Xiaohongshu and initially wanted to book the chief physician Liang Haiying or deputy chief physician Zhang Li. However, I couldn't secure an appointment and ended up booking Geng Xinming over the phone. Reviews about this doctor on Xiaohongshu were mixed, so I gave it a try mainly because I couldn't book any other doctors.

The first visit was at 15 weeks + 4 days. I initially went to get a mid-pregnancy tang test. When I entered, he threw my medical record book on the table with a sullen face and told me my timing wasnâ€™t right, and to come back at 17 weeks while fasting. When he saw the free anomaly scan I booked with another doctor for 23 weeks+, he scared me by saying the timing was useless, no need to go for it, and insisted I do it at their hospital.

The second visit was at 17 weeks. I couldn't get an appointment earlier than 8 days in advance, and my appointment was at 10:30 in the morning. Since I have hypoglycemia, I explained my condition to the doctor at 9+ and asked for the fasting mid-pregnancy tang test request first. Then, I got scolded; he said he wouldnâ€™t take responsibility for anything, wouldnâ€™t check any of my medical records, and even told me to sign on a sick leave note stating it was my own request, and he'd bear no responsibility. (I said it was him who asked me to come at this time in our previous visit.) After this, he kicked me out.

I was trembling from low blood sugar and went back in and asked directly for the test request myself, saying I would be responsible for it. I also asked for the anomaly scan request (again scolded, saying fasting for mid-pregnancy tang test wasnâ€™t necessary and that at this time, many tests required fasting; it was my own fault for having breakfast). According to him, any resulting problem wasnâ€™t his responsibility.

Extremely frustrating!!! He kept contradicting himself about whether fasting was needed ğŸ™‚

Later, after the blood draw, I found out he didn't issue me an anomaly scan request. So, I went back to him, and he gave me a check-up order worth 1500 RMB (like for a Mediterranean anemia test, thyroid function, etc., all of which I had already done before pregnancy!!!!). Then he directly gave me a third-trimester anomaly scan order, suggesting an earlier free second-trimester one at 18 weeks and self-funded third-trimester anomaly scan at 23 weeks.

Later, at the nurse station, they told me I didnâ€™t have free vouchers. After running around, I found out from the community hospital that since I had booked an appointment at another hospital before, I couldn't double-book for the second-trimester anomaly scan. (But last time Geng Xinming said I could rebook at their hospital. When my husband asked him further, he coldly replied to us, "Do whatever you want. You can get checked wherever you want to go.")

Later, we called the original hospital, and they explained the Provincial Maternity and Child Health Hospital liked scheduling anomaly scans at 18 weeks, which is basically useless, so you'd have to pay out of pocket for a third-trimester anomaly scan. However, their 23-week appointment was at the correct timing and not a mistake. (Geng Xinming kept scaring me, saying that anomaly scans at 23 weeks werenâ€™t necessary and wouldnâ€™t be valuable.)

I wasted 3 hours in this hospital... Definitely avoiding this doctor in the future. Is there any way to file a complaint against him? He just wants to issue expensive orders without taking any responsibility. After I left, I heard a young man quarreling loudly with him, but I don't know the details. I can only confirm that this doctor has an extremely poor attitude!!! Definitely avoid!!! Pregnant women should have a good mood, but visiting him only leads to frustration. He even throws the medical records straight at you! [DisappointedR][DisappointedR][DisappointedR]

content:
Query: 
How to lose weight effectively at 130 pounds
Level:
Physical exercise

Doc:
<Doc>
5 Secrets to Rapid Weight Loss: The Most Effective Methods!
1. **Diet Control:** Reduce the intake of high-calorie, high-fat, and high-sugar foods, and increase the consumption of vegetables, fruits, whole grains, and proteins. Maintaining a proper diet plan helps reduce calorie intake and boost metabolism.
	
2. **Increase Aerobic Exercise:** Aerobic exercises such as running, skipping, and swimming can help burn calories and reduce body fat. Engage in at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic exercise or 75 minutes of high-intensity aerobic exercise per week.
	
3. **Incorporate Strength Training:** Strength training can increase muscle mass, boost basal metabolic rate, and aid in long-term weight loss. Options include equipment-based training, weightlifting, or bodyweight training.
	
4. **Stay Hydrated:** Drinking enough water helps maintain fullness, boosts metabolism, and removes waste from the body, aiding in weight loss.
	
5. **Maintain a Regular Routine:** Good sleep habits and a consistent daily routine help regulate hormone levels, control appetite, and promote a healthy weight loss process.
	
Please note that any weight loss plan should be carried out under the guidance of a doctor or professional health consultant to ensure safety and effectiveness. Moreover, consistent healthy eating and exercise habits are key to maintaining a long-term healthy weight.
	
          
</Doc>

content:
Query: 
Guide Gong novel
Level:
Novel name

Doc:
<Doc>
Long novels are yyds! If you like slow-paced pure love, just dive in without hesitation ahhhhh!
Knock knock knock! Today, Big Wen is recommending a long pure love novel! "Infrastructure Starts from the Multiverse General Store" by the author Weizhang Jinting. The full text is now completed!
The protagonist runs a small general store that trades goods across different dimensions. It's easy to assume from this setup that it's a management story, but the author's focus is not merely on running the general store. Instead, it delves more into infrastructure development and aiding the construction of order in various dimensions.
There are three dimensions in totalâ€”primitive, cultivation, and Western fantasyâ€”entered sequentially in time order. However, this doesn't mean the plot of the previous dimension ends upon entering the next. Stories from all dimensions unfold simultaneously and interweave in various ways.
The hallmark of the author is the meticulous writing style full of human warmth. The stories of various people in each world and the changes brought by the protagonist are written with great detail. Lovers of such writing will feel deeply immersed, while those who dislike it might find it a bit drawn-out or too slow-paced.
The romantic subplot follows the same pattern. The characters are quite appealingâ€”a naive and strong young man rescued by the protagonist from a primitive tribe. The cold-faced general store owner and the innocent beautiful boyâ€”I was totally hooked! However, in the early stages, they both like each other but never break the tension. The mutual ambiguity persists until near the end when they finally get together, which drove me crazy with anticipation.
Overall, if you can accept a slow pace and enjoy management and infrastructure themes, this is worth checking out! #NovelRecommendation[Topic]# #BookRescue[Topic]# #BookShortage[Topic]# #Recommendation[Topic]# #DailyRecommendation[Topic]# #PureLove[Topic]# #Infrastructure[Topic]# #SlowPaced[Topic]#
</Doc>
